intro: Crotalaria elegans, commonly known as the elegant crown flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and bean-like pods. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow with a distinctive black or purple spot at the base of the petals. Crotalaria elegans is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
